definition: to tiptoe
to walk on tiptoe/to walk quietly/to tread (on)/to follow
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: I listened carefully to do the footsteps, chickadee.
sentences.chinese: 我侧着耳朵听，蹑着脚步行。

sentences.english: He tiptoed out of the ward.

definition: to walk quietly on tiptoe (idiom)
to walk cautiously in order not to make noise
to walk on tiptoe/to step on sb's foot/to join (a trade, profession etc)/to associate with (a certain group of people)
(to move or do sth) softly and quietly (idiom)
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
at a slow pace
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
foot of a wall
small quick steps
to visit/to go to see what's going on
to peep/to spy on
to bend over
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
sneaky/furtive
to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
to stroll/to saunter
